class Solution:
    def minChanges(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:
        d1 = defaultdict(int)
        d2 = defaultdict(int)
        res = len(nums)//2

        for i in range(len(nums)//2):
            a,b = nums[i],nums[len(nums)-i-1]           
            tmp = min(a,b,k-a,k-b)
            d2[tmp] += 1
            d1[abs(a-b)]+=1
        arr = []
        for n in d2:
            arr.append([n,d2[n]])
        arr.sort(reverse = True)
        for i in range(1,len(arr)):
            arr[i][1] += arr[i-1][1]
        arr = arr[::-1]
        for X in d1:
            thres = [k-X+1,0]
            ind = bisect.bisect(arr,thres)
            #print(X, ind)
            cur = len(nums)//2
            if ind < len(arr):
                cur += arr[ind][1]
            cur -= d1[X]
            res = min(res,cur)
        #print(arr)


        return res
